comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Hmmm.... Cornelia McLanahan Curtis (b. 1908) was the daughter of railroad executive Frederick Kingsbury Curtis and Cornelia Day McLanahan (1873-1965), and married Laurence M. Lombard in 1931. select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F00612F73C5C1473... en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederick_Kingsbury_Curtis This could be the daughter, but it might also be the mother? Neither set of dates seems right for the photo.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Her wedding is reported,with a photo of the bride that could well be the same woman, on December 13, 1931 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F00612F73C5C1473...

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: So maybe this is one of the stray photos from the 1920s that got into this set?  That would fit the wedding date and the daughter's birthdate (and her style, which looks more 1927 than 1915).

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: pennylrichardsca and swanq:  The combination of the similar photo, date on negative and other information you have provided, seem to indicate that this is the daughter Cornelia McLanahan Curtis (b. 1908) who married in 1931.  We will add some of this information to the description.
